common.inputError: Please enter a number greater than or equal to 0

process.title: Assessment Process
process.description: This assessment system includes six parts to comprehensively evaluate your microplastics intake:

items.title: Environmental Water Sources
items.description: Assess microplastics intake from daily drinking water, including tap water, bottled water, and other sources.

items.title: Food Intake
items.description: Analyze microplastics content in daily food, including seafood, vegetables, and other food items.

items.title: Air Exposure
items.description: Evaluate microplastics intake through breathing, considering different environmental conditions.

items.title: Daily Items
items.description: Analyze microplastics released from daily plastic products, such as tea bags and utensils.

items.title: Clothing and Textiles
items.description: Assess microplastic fibers released during clothing washing.

items.title: Dietary Habits
items.description: Analyze the impact of special dietary habits on microplastics intake, such as seafood consumption frequency.

result.title: Assessment Results
result.description: After completing the assessment, you will receive:

footer.aboutDesc: PlasticontAI provides you with a rough assessment of your daily intake of microplastics and offers targeted AI recommendations to help you reduce your exposure to microplastics.

waterSource.title: Part 1: Environmental Water Sources
waterSource.infoDescription: Please enter your daily intake of three types of water sources in milliliters (mL)
waterSource.inputDescription: Please fill in the following data based on your actual situation

reference.bottle: ðŸ’¡ Reference: Standard water bottle is 500mL, large bottle is 1.5L
reference.daily: ðŸ’¡ Reference: Recommended daily water intake is 1500-2000mL, equivalent to 3-4 standard water bottles

food.title: Part 2: Food Intake
food.introText: Please enter your daily food consumption

milk.name: Milk/Soft Drinks
milk.subtitle: (e.g., milk, soda, juice)
milk.reference: ðŸ’¡ Reference: Regular bottle is 500ml-1L, large bottle is 1.5L-2L, one box of milk is usually 250ml

takeaway.name: Takeaway Food
takeaway.subtitle: (e.g., takeout boxes, packed food)
takeaway.reference: ðŸ’¡ Reference: Regular takeout box is 0.5L-1L, large portion is 1.5L-2L

honey.name: Honey
honey.subtitle: (e.g., honey, royal jelly)
honey.reference: ðŸ’¡ Reference: Regular honey bottle is 500g-1kg, small package is 100g-250g

sugar.name: Sugar
sugar.subtitle: (e.g., white sugar, brown sugar)
sugar.reference: ðŸ’¡ Reference: Regular sugar packet is 5g-10g, family pack is 500g-1kg

salt.name: Salt (Sea Salt)
salt.subtitle: (e.g., sea salt, table salt)
salt.reference: ðŸ’¡ Reference: Regular salt packet is 5g-10g, family pack is 500g-1kg, recommended daily intake is no more than 6g

rice.name: Raw Rice
rice.subtitle: (e.g., regular rice, brown rice)
rice.reference: ðŸ’¡ Reference: One bowl of rice is about 150g-200g, one bag of rice is usually 5kg-10kg

instantRice.name: Instant Rice
instantRice.subtitle: (e.g., instant rice, ready-to-eat rice)
instantRice.reference: ðŸ’¡ Reference: One pack of instant rice is usually 100g-200g, ready-to-eat rice box is about 200g-300g

air.title: Part 3: Air Exposure
air.introText: Please enter your weight and living area type to calculate your daily microplastic intake
air.breathingData: Daily breathing volume per kg of body weight is approximately
air.areaReference: Reference: Urban areas include commercial and residential areas; Suburban areas include urban-rural fringe and satellite cities; Coastal areas include seaside cities and ports

errors.weightInvalid: Please enter a number greater than or equal to 0
errors.areaTypeRequired: Please select your living area type

breathing.name: Breathing Volume Calculation
breathing.subtitle: (Based on body weight)

teaBags.name: Plastic Tea Bags
teaBags.subtitle: (e.g., tea bags, tea sachets)

plasticUtensils.label: Number of times using plastic utensils (times/day)
plasticUtensils.reference: ðŸ’¡ Reference: Including disposable chopsticks, spoons, forks, and plastic containers

clothing.introText: Please enter your clothing and home textile usage:

cotton.name: Total Clothing

analysis.title: Intake Analysis
analysis.errorMessage: Failed to get analysis results, please click retry
analysis.prompt:
Please analyze the following data (limit to 150 words):
Total microplastics intake: {total} particles/day
Main sources:
{sources}

Focus on:
1. Main intake sources and their risk levels
2. Potential health risk assessment
3. Comparison with general population

tips.title: Health Tips
tips.errorMessage: Failed to get health tips, please click retry
tips.prompt:
Please provide specific and actionable improvement suggestions based on the following data (limit to 150 words):
Total microplastics intake: {total} particles/day
Source distribution:
{sources}

Please provide:
1. Specific reduction plans for TOP3 sources
2. Daily life actionable measures
3. Long-term improvement suggestions
